title: Renmark on the river
creator_contributor_role: South Australian Government Tourist Bureau, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Murray River (N.S.W.-S. Aust.)
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/South Australia - Description and travel
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Irrigation - Murray River Region (N.S.W.-S. Aust.)
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Rivers - Australia
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Fruit trade - Australia
description: Presents Renmark as Australia's first irrigation settlement. Introduces the Renmark Trust utilizing the waters of the Murray River to irrigate fruit trees and vines. We see oranges prepared for market whilst other fruits include apricots, peaches, pears, lemons and grapefruit; and vineyards produce sultanas, raisins, and grapes for wine making. The scenic attractions of the River and town are also seen.
